channel.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
channel.description: Hi, I need help with coding, I have a dial +/- connected via gpio/analog out to a knob, this knob doesn‚Äôt have a center detent, I would modify the dial to obtain a sort of center detent like behavior, in specific if the dial goes from -64 to +64 and the 1 is the center, I would program a tolerance, when the dial is between -5 to 6 the value is equal to 1. Anyone could help me? I‚Äôm not so skilled in coding, I hope to be clear in explaining my tasküòÖ Many Thanks

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

Hi, I tried to place the ceramic capacitors as you suggested but the pots became more unstable with than without it I also tried with 10pF and 432nF but the result is the same

Read full topic

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

Thank you, I‚Äôll try with the capacitors
What about the midi I already have something similar to your suggestion in my patch but the attenuverter case is different, like the following sketch

AB310EF8-0B0B-4324-92E7-7B3EC10D225E.jpeg2936x1158 241 KB

I need to smooth (or apply krate lpf) the behavior of the control of attenuverter.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

If your potentiometers are not connected to the Axoloti itself, adding a capactor is probably the way to go.

What you can try is to add the MIDI CC to a ctrl/dial p object, run that one through a math/smooth object and then to the inlet of the parameter you want to control. Normally you would add the MIDI CC to the dial on the object itself.

CleanShot 2022-04-01 at 11.32.19@2x.png878x542 18 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

Thank you both @janvantomme @borututuforte for the tips, I propably missed some details, sorry about that:
In my case the control knob (UI) is connected to the doepfer usb64, usb64 to axo core via usb port, in the patch the knob is mapped to a midi cc, so which is the best way to apply the krate lowpass filter? (I think it could solve this issue, I have already applied krate lpf to gpio inputs but not with midi inputs)
Actually my patch is at the limit of SRAM overflow and I have already optimized it (left to right, top to bottom placement of the objects) so I can‚Äôt add too many modules thank you for your support

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

I usually add a 100nF ceramic capacitor between the middle pin of the potentiometer and GND to filter out noise.

Remaining noise picked up on the GPIO pin can be filtered with math/smooth. Middle scope simulates the noise of the GPIO, right scope shows the filtered signal.

CleanShot 2022-03-31 at 13.10.13@2x.png1478x918 45.4 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @borututuforte
item.description:
@borututuforte wrote:

If the offset is constant, just use "math/+c" or "math/-c" to set it right.
If the values change, that's just noise picked up by the analog circuit. If you need to get rid of it, use "kfilter/lowpass" to filter out fast value changes.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Ah, yeah, that's a bit trickier, I was thinking of a different use...

I was curious so had a play, one of the kfunc objects @borututuforte mentioned gets close, I think this would work (with no modulation between -8 and 8, and inverted when negative). But, that's a fair chunk of knob range to lose, a center detent knob would be much better.

Capture.JPG842x597 21.1 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

thank you for your questions the goal is to have a polarity knob that inverts or not inverts the phase of the lfo and also controls its amplitude (attenuverter) with a center detent without having a center detent knob, problably I'm not enough skilled in patching to obtain it easily and probably the best choice is as suggests @janvantomme to buy some center detent knobs

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Yeah, there will be no change in that range, but wasn't that the purpose? To create a kind of center dead zone for the control so the output value is 1 if the control is between -5 and 6?

Re the lfo - why put it through the mechanism for the control? You could add it to the signal after the mechanism (after the mux 2 and before the display dial in my screenshot) and then it should behave normally, I think.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)

item.title: Help with attenuverter with center detent (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @KF78 KevinFollet
item.description:
@KF78 wrote:

@MattilynMattroe I tried to implement the patch to my UI but unfortunately the behavior was unexpected, the control works correctly but the signal coming out is affected by the ‚Äútolerance‚Äù of the control knob, so I solved a task generating another one for example if I process an lfo it cycles between -64 and 64 but near the -5 to 5 interval is constant to 0...and it‚Äôs unwanted. Thank you anyway for the suggestion

Read full topic
